title.rendered: Pennsylvania Chimney And Fireplace Cleaning: Why a Clean Chimney Matters

content.rendered:
The safest and best-performing chimneys and fireplaces are those that receive regular cleaning and maintenance by expert technicians. If your chimney is neglected, it can accumulate a dangerous buildup of soot and creosote.

For the uninitiated, creosote is a tar-like, sticky substance that is highly inflammable. Creosote is the reason why more than 25,000 chimney fires occur in the US each year. In this post, we are going to break down all the reasons why a clean chimney is not only preferable but essential.

3 Reasons Why Pennsylvania Chimney Cleaning Is Crucial

Many homeowners don’t really understand the importance of getting their chimneys cleaned by certified professionals. Professional Pennsylvania chimney cleaning experts use special tools and expertise to remove the creosote and dirt buildup, and to increase the heating efficiency of the chimney. Here are some reasons why it’s paramount to have a well-cared-for chimney:

Reduced Risk of Chimney Fires

Chimney fires are more common than many think. While some chimney fires are very tiny and extinguish on their own, some are so big, they can engulf the whole house.

But even the small fires are enough to damage the interior masonry and chimney liners, leaving flammable materials of your home (like curtains and wood furniture) susceptible to the fire.

Here are some common signs that indicate a chimney fire is imminent:

  • You hear a rumbling sound from the chimney (it may sound like a distant train)
  • You hear a tapping or ticking sound
  • You notice an abnormally large amount of smoke flowing into the room or pouring from the top of the chimney

Creosote Removal

Creosote is a sticky or flakey substance that appears as a byproduct of smoke. As we said earlier, this flammable substance is the cause of the majority of chimney fires in the country every year.

According to the Chimney Safety Institute of America (CSIA), you should have your chimney inspected at least once a year. If your chimney is connected to a wood-burning fireplace, it is extremely pivotal to call Pennsylvania chimney cleaning specialists every 12 months or so, because even a 1-inch buildup of creosote is enough to start a disastrous chimney fire.

Obstruction Removal

Pennsylvania chimney cleaning experts won’t only remove the creosote but also remove any obstructions inside the flue, such as twigs, leaves, small animal nests, dead critters, etc. This kind of debris will make smoke draft improperly and back up into your house, moving with it lethal carbon monoxide. 

The best way to keep all the dirt and clutter out of your chimney flue is by having a good quality chimney cap installed. These caps prevent debris and water from entering the flue while allowing the smoke to move through easily.

Let Us Ensure The Safety Of Your Chimney

Is your fireplace producing more smoke than it should? Are you or anyone in your home displaying signs of carbon monoxide poisoning? Do you think your heating bills should be lower considering the amount of wood you’re burning?

If you answered “yes” to any of these questions, it’s highly likely that your fireplace and chimney need to be inspected and cleaned right away.
